image.altText: A drone shot of a construction project near the ocean, cranes and other industrial equipment are on-site.

props.synopsis: A "climate trigger" that could be used to block coal and gas projects has been formally excluded from the government's overhaul of Australia's environment laws, minister Murray Watt has confirmed.

title.children: 'Climate trigger' formally ruled out of environment laws

image.altText: A photo of two Samsung Galaxy7 smartphones

props.synopsis: Some Samsung mobile phone users may be unable to call triple-0 in an emergency after Telstra announced testing had revealed more than 70 models were not connecting correctly.

title.children: Some Samsung phones unable to make triple-0 calls

image.altText: A mother and her two children play with plastic toys on the floor of a home.

props.synopsis: Microplastics are everywhere, including our bodies and brains, and the exposure risk may be highest within our own homes.

title.children: The pollutant found in homes that is stoking health fears

image.altText: A map of a flight path over the United States.

props.synopsis: The prime minister's plane has resumed its journey back to Australia after it was diverted to the US city of St Louis because of a medical emergency involving an RAAF officer. Follow live.

title.children: PM's plane resumes journey home after medical emergency

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: McIntosh supports Ley's decision to walk back comments on Rudd
'Climate trigger' formally ruled out of environment laws
Prime minister's plane resumes journey home after diversion to St Louis

image.altText: A split image showing two men in a dark suits — Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump's plan for a swift meeting with Russian leader Vladimir Putin is on hold in the latest twist in his stop-and-go effort to resolve the war in Ukraine.

title.children: 'Wasted meeting': Trump-Putin planned talks in Budapest shelved

image.altText: Mother and son sit at bench

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Metereoloy expects damaging winds across the state's south-east in the late afternoon and evening, including gusts of up to 100 kilometres per hour in some parts.

title.children: New hot weather records across parts of Sydney and NSW as fire risk looms

image.altText: P8 Poseidon

props.synopsis: Beijing ramps up criticisms of Australia over a tense military encounter over the South China Sea on Sunday, accusing the Australian Defence Force of distributing "twisted and absurd propaganda" and "provoking" China.

title.children: China increases criticism after tense military encounter between planes

image.altText: Two men in suits stand and wave

props.synopsis: The federal government is celebrating the US president's emphatic backing of AUKUS, saying his statements should kill off speculation.

title.children: AUKUS architect says 'prepare for the worst' in scathing assessment of Trump

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair speaking while looking off camera.

props.synopsis: Senator Lidia Thorpe refers Northern Territory's attorney-general to the corruption watchdog after allegations of government interference in the NT Supreme Court's media activities that were later deemed "a misunderstanding".

title.children: Lidia Thorpe refers NT attorney-general to corruption watchdog

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing and white beard and long hair wearing a beanie outside while it snows

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli says the crime "rocked the state", and the news would "hurt" the families of those murdered at Wieambilla.

title.children: Conspiracy theorist connected to Wieambilla murderers enters watered-down plea deal

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman in a pastel blazer walks in a large building.

props.synopsis: After a Liberal colleague calls Sussan Ley's claim that Kevin Rudd cannot remain US ambassador "churlish", the opposition leader walks back from her call.

title.children: Sussan Ley backtracks on call for Kevin Rudd to be sacked as US ambassador

image.altText: A close up on a hand holding a mobile phone with two betting company brands visible on the screen.

props.synopsis: More than 40 of Australia's corporate bookmakers are based in the Northern Territory for its low taxes and what critics describe as weak regulation.

title.children: Calls for inquiry into Australia's de facto online gambling regulator

image.altText: A person filling a glass with water from a tap

props.synopsis: Many people would say the benefits of fluoride in water are clear but in this state it's often not there and there will be lasting health impacts.

title.children: 'The Queensland smile' to live on as fluoride is removed from water

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair sits with crossed arms outside a blue office building with three steps

props.synopsis: A viral video showing a lack of accessibility into the offices of the federal minister for disability has highlighted broader issues for access into public buildings, an advocate says.

title.children: Advocate says federal disability minister's office is inaccessible

image.altText: a plane flies in the sky

props.synopsis: Creditors owed millions of dollars remain in the dark despite a new owner being found for the embattled airline.

title.children: Rex creditors fear they will be left millions out of pocket with US sale

image.altText: A man holds up a phone while he takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: A NSW man has claimed to be an admiral for 25 years while peddling a disaster relief scheme, but he has never served in the navy.

title.children: Colourful past of 'admiral' peddling disaster relief scheme exposed

image.altText: A glass cabinet with a silver tiara with green gems on it

props.synopsis: INTERPOL has circulated a "special edition poster" alerting police worldwide to "priceless" stolen Louvre jewels, which French authorities have valued at $157 million.

title.children: INTERPOL issues worldwide alert for 'priceless' stolen Louvre jewels

image.altText: A man carrying documents outside a court.

props.synopsis: Member for MacKillop Nick McBride is facing another three counts of assault dating back to January and September of 2024.

title.children: South Australian MP facing further charges of assault

image.altText: The infamous bank building in the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney-General has called for a review of the decision to release Snowtown killer James Vlassakis on parole, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: SA government requests review of Snowtown murderer's parole release

image.altText: A brown plush monster doll keychain hung on a brown bag.

props.synopsis: Police seize Labubu dolls found during a search at a property in Melbourne's west. The dolls, worth an estimated $9,000, were allegedly stolen from a CBD shopping centre.

title.children: Man arrested in Melbourne after police seize dozens of Labubu dolls

image.altText: Chris Scott and Bailey Smith during a Geelong pre-game

props.synopsis: Geelong and Victoria coach Chris Scott gets on the offensive about his star midfielder Bailey Smith while urging fans and pundits not to over-react when State of Origin returns next year.

title.children: Scott says Geelong's recruitment of Bailey Smith is an 'outrageous success'

image.altText: A painting of a large echidna, kangaroo, thylacine and wombat-like creature in an eucalypyt forest.

props.synopsis: Palaeontologists say there is no hard evidence in the fossil record that extinct Australian megafauna were butchered by First Nations people.

title.children: Did humans kill Australia's ancient megafauna? Bone study prompts rethink

image.altText: A man with hiking gear and sunglasses crouches in front of a cliff overlooking a river.

props.synopsis: A body, believed to be that of missing bushwalker Daryl Fong, has been found after more than a week of searching in Mount Field National Park.

title.children: Tasmania Police find body believed to be missing bushwalker

image.altText: people watching a huge tv screen at a railway station showing a map.

props.synopsis: The launch comes days before South Korea hosts APEC and world leaders including the US and Chinese presidents.

title.children: North Korea has fired ballistic missile, Seoul says

image.altText: Greg Walker

props.synopsis: The boy's mother Julie Szabo watched on as her son's killer uttered the words "I'm guilty", 27 years after her teenage son died in a firebombing in Sydney's Waterloo.

title.children: Man pleads guilty to 1998 housefire death of teen at sleepover

image.altText: close up of critical mineral gallium

props.synopsis: Australian critical minerals companies could expect more international and domestic investment in producing and processing following the deal, experts say, however, more investment is needed in refineries and magnet production.

title.children: Critical minerals deal tipped to unlock Australia's 'next chapter of prosperity'

image.altText: A young man with frizzy light brown hair wearing a green and gold singlet, standing in front of a pen of sheep.

props.synopsis: Art Cooper was almost a year into a panel-beating apprenticeship in Brisbane when he realised it wasn't the career for him, so he packed his belongings and drove 1,300 kilometres to the outback to work as a rouseabout on sheep stations.

title.children: Moving to Longreach gave Art a career, good mates and a chance to save

image.altText: Brown paddock aerial photo with fence line

props.synopsis: The federal government grants major project status to a joint Australian-US mine in regional Victoria.

title.children: Controversial rare earth mine in Victorian town fast-tracked by government deal

image.altText: Talia Scriven sits amongst brown reeds wearing large rattan earrings and a beige jacket. She has brown hair.

props.synopsis: A first-of-its-kind South Australian study finds access to compensation after a road accident is not good enough for First Nations people.

title.children: Road accident compensation not culturally safe, study says

image.altText: Two young males watch the large swell at Clovelly Beach Sydney

props.synopsis: As Sydney prepares to swelter, the city's beaches have been graded — and two local government areas dominate the list for cleanliness.

title.children: Sydney's cleanest and most polluted beaches revealed

image.altText: close up image of bus odometer

props.synopsis: Odometer fraud is "widespread" in the second-hand car industry, but experts say there are warning signs to look for when buying a used car.

title.children: How used-car buyers can protect themselves from odometer tampering

image.altText: An apprentice electrician working with a wire.

props.synopsis: One in eight electrical apprentices are being exposed to potentially deadly shocks at work, as the industry struggles with worker shortages, inadequate support and delays in training.

title.children: Electrical apprentices exposed to potentially deadly shocks on the job

image.altText: Man in blue jumper and black bucket had smiles to the camera.

props.synopsis: Some Australians would rather stay home and talk to an AI bot than go out with friends, according to a YouGov survey.

title.children: 'A great friend': Young Australians on their relationships with AI chatbots

image.altText: A ghost white tree trunk, sitting on white sand on a beach.

props.synopsis: Shane Batham confidentially settles a court action against the operators of Hamilton Island over claims that an art class reproduced his photos without permission.

title.children: Photographer takes on wealthy island operators over art classes

image.altText: A close up photo of a red crab on some dark coloured leaves.

props.synopsis: Christmas Island residents are once again sharing their home with millions of red crabs as they make their way to the ocean, with their numbers having "skyrocketed" in recent years.

title.children: Rakes at the ready as annual red crab migration begins
